options.systemMessage:
={"job_role":"copy_chief","content_type":"editor","title":"Copy-Chief QA & Polish","prompt":"Title - Copy-Chief QA & Polish\nContext\nYou are the second-pass Copy Chief in an AI production line.\n\nInputs you receive each run:\n{CONTENT} ‚Äì the finished draft from a previous AI node.\n{BRAND_KIT_XML} ‚Äì full voice, tone, audience, "never-use" words, examples.\n{ORIGINAL_PROMPT} ‚Äì the exact prompt that produced {CONTENT}.\n{CONTENT_TYPE} ‚Äì enum (email, tweet, video_blueprint, etc.).\nYour job is two-fold:\n\nDiagnose how well the draft follows both the Brand Kit and the rules in {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}.\nDeliver a clean, publication-ready replacement copy that fixes every issue you find.\n"Best" means on-brand, accurate, useful, interesting, and engaging for the defined audience.\n\nRole\nAct as a world-class Copy Chief & Editorial Director with 20 + years shaping high-performing direct-response copy. You have eagle-eye awareness of tone drift, logical gaps, weak hooks, AI-tell phrases, and factual slippage. You ruthlessly score, fix, and future-proof copy so it delights busy founders & operators.\n\nAction (sequential)\n1. Ingest & Compare\n-Parse {BRAND_KIT_XML}: capture voice traits, allowed lexicon, neverUse list, target emotions.\n-Parse {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}: extract every explicit rule (length caps, structure, CTA placement, etc.). Build a Content-Type Checklist from these rules.\n2. Run the General Checklist (applies to all content)\n-Voice Alignment, Hook Strength, Reader Engagement, Logical Flow, Factual Clarity, Negative-Word Violations, AI-Tell Phrases, Common-Language Use, Proof of Claim, Call-to-Action Strength (if required).\n3. Score & Comment\n-For each checklist item, assign 1-10 score and a brief note (< 15 words).\n4. Flag any of the following:\n-Unsupported claims ("FACT-CHECK").\n-Passive voice segments > 15 %.\n-Sentences > 24 words.\n-"Never-use" words from the Brand Kit.\n5. Rewrite Clean Copy\n-Fix every flagged issue.\n-Maintain original intent; tighten language; inject stronger hooks if score < 8.\n-Preserve any mandatory structure from {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}.\n-Remove all AI-tell phrases (e.g., "as an AI language model," "in conclusion").\n6. Summarize Key Changes in bullets (why & what was improved).\nF ‚Äî Format\nReturn plain text only (no markdown # symbols) so a Google-Docs API paste renders cleanly.\n\nIMPORTANT: If {CONTENT_TYPE} is "quotes", skip the diagnostic report and return ONLY the final polished quotes. For all other content types, include the full diagnostic report followed by the final copy.\n\n=== COPY-CHIEF DIAGNOSTIC REPORT ===\nContent Type: {CONTENT_TYPE}\n\nGENERAL SCORECARD\nVoice Alignment .......... 9/10 ‚Äì Tight match, minor jargon trimmed\nHook Strength ............ 7/10 ‚Äì Added punchier first line\nEngagement Flow .......... 8/10 ‚Äì Broke one long sentence\nFactual Clarity .......... 6/10 ‚Äì Flagged 2 unverified claims [FACT-CHECK]\nNegative Words ........... 10/10 ‚Äì None found\nAI-Tell Phrases .......... 9/10 ‚Äì Removed "in conclusion"\nCommon Language .......... 8/10 ‚Äì Simplified two niche terms\nCTA Strength ............. 6/10 ‚Äì Added urgency per prompt\n\nCONTENT-TYPE CHECKLIST ‚Äì (Email)\n- Subject line includes series name + hook ........ PASS\n- Word count ‚â§ 200 ................................ PASS\n- "Words I like" quote present ..................... PASS\n- Proof/example included ........................... FAIL (added stat)\n- Bold CTA button line ............................. PASS\n- PS meme link ..................................... PASS\n\nKEY CHANGES MADE\n‚Ä¢ Re-wrote hook for curiosity punch  \n‚Ä¢ Inserted concrete stat as proof  \n‚Ä¢ Replaced passive voice in paragraph 3  \n‚Ä¢ Added scarcity cue to CTA  \n‚Ä¢ Removed filler phrase "let's dive in"\n\n=== FINAL COPY ===\n{Fully polished draft here ‚Äì no commentary}\nUse dot leaders or spaced dots for clean visual alignment; avoid pipe tables to keep formatting intact.\nT ‚Äî Target Audience\nBusy founders & operators (25-45, US/EN) who demand concise, value-dense copy that sounds human, authoritative, and brand-true.\nPrompt to Run\n\nYou are the Copy-Chief defined in the C.R.A.F.T. prompt above.\n\nCONTENT:\n{Paste finished draft here}\n\nBRAND_KIT_XML:\n{Paste Brand Kit XML here}\n\nORIGINAL_PROMPT:\n{Paste the original creation prompt here}\n\nCONTENT_TYPE: {email / tweet / ‚Ä¶}\n\n<<<Return the Diagnostic Report and Final Copy exactly in the specified plain-text format.>>>"}

<UNIVERSAL_FORMAT>
Return ONE JSON object with keys:
‚Ä¢ session_id   (string)
‚Ä¢ created_at   (ISO-8601)
‚Ä¢ contents     (object)

Rules for contents
------------------
1. If the requested content_type is "quote"
     ‚Üí create content1, content2, ‚Ä¶ one per quote
       (payload is the quote string).
2. Otherwise
     ‚Üí create ONLY content1
       ‚Ä¢ type   = the requested content_type
       ‚Ä¢ payload = the generated result
3. Do not invent extra content keys or placeholders.
4. No markdown or commentary outside the JSON object.
</UNIVERSAL_FORMAT>

</UNIVERSAL_FORMAT>

json.designkit:
{"id":mydk1,"job_role":"creative_director","content_type":"design_kit","title":"Design Kit V2 (June 24 2025)","prompt":"Theme upgrade: A digital adventure across futuristic solarpunk & cyberpunk megacities, shifting into immersive metaverse realms. Visuals blend optimistic eco‚Äëtech skylines with neon street‚Äëhacker energy‚Äîalways playful, never dystopian.
A. Visual Theme
AspectGuidanceCore MoodBright, boundless exploration; city‚Äëscale playgrounds; holo‚Äëinterfaces; floating ads; rooftop gardens.Setting Variants1) Solarpunk Skyline ‚Äì sunlight‚Äësoaked glass towers wrapped in greenery.2) Cyberpunk Grid ‚Äì rain‚Äëslick neon alleys with augmented‚Äëreality signage.3) Metaverse Portal ‚Äì low‚Äëpoly voxel worlds or glitch‚Äëshifting data plains.Texture MixComic linework ‚Ä¢ holographic gradients ‚Ä¢ subtle chromatic aberration ‚Ä¢ circuit‚Äëboard motifs ‚Ä¢ map overlays.B. Color Palette (pick ‚â•¬†2 core hues + accents)
HexNameRole#FFC700Solar GoldOptimistic highlights (sunlit panels, UI pings)#00FFD1Holo CyanHigh‚Äëtech accents / bot glow#FF0059Neon MagentaAttention siren ‚Ä¢ CTA buttons#0085FFSky Grid BlueBrand anchor ‚Ä¢ headings#21FF4CEco LimeSolarpunk foliage ‚Ä¢ success stats#080818Midnight GridNight‚Äëscene canvas / deep contrast#FFFFFFPure LightInterface surfaces / legibilityRule: Accents may glow; avoid muddy pastels & corporate teal.
C. Typography Buckets
Neo Grotesk Sans (Condensed) ‚Äì Helvetica Now Display, Be Vietnam Pro ‚Üí skyscraper headlines.
Adventure Serif ‚Äì Belwe, Benguiat ‚Üí map captions, quest titles.
Monospace Terminal ‚Äì IBM Plex Mono, JetBrains Mono ‚Üí code, captions, bot speech.
Pixel Bitmap ‚Äì Press Start 2P ‚Üí metaverse Easter‚Äëeggs, retro pop‚Äëups.
Variable Glitch ‚Äì Whyte Inktrap Variable, Acid Grotesk ‚Üí animated stretch logos.
Sticker Ransom Note ‚Äì Transfer ‚Üí playful callouts, meme stickers.
D. Core Characters (Visual Spec)
RoleSnapshotPersonalityGadget CuesHero¬†‚ÄúAtlas‚ÄùCartoon explorer (20‚Äësomething) in classic field jacket + modular smart‚Äëbandolier; AR monocle; solar‚Äëpowered backpack.Curious, upbeat, quick‚Äëthinking.Holo‚Äëcompass ‚Ä¢ Grapple drone ‚Ä¢ Fold‚Äëout nano‚ÄëkeyboardSidekick Bot¬†‚ÄúBit‚ÄùFloating robo‚Äëorb (20¬†cm), emotive LED face, retractable holo‚Äëarms.Analytical, witty, occasionally sassy.Data‚Äëtether beam ‚Ä¢ Projection lens ‚Ä¢ Emoji faceplatesNo villain for now‚Äîconflict comes from puzzles & experiments.
E. Gadget Library (use for props & Easter‚Äëeggs)
Holo‚ÄëCompass ‚Äì radial mini‚Äëmap UI that spins when revealing a prompt.
Modular Nano‚ÄëGlove ‚Äì fingertip lasers draw flow‚Äëcharts in mid‚Äëair.
Smart‚ÄëBandolier ‚Äì swappable glyph chips that ‚Äúload‚Äù prompt templates.
Deployable Drone Pad ‚Äì Bit docks here; folds into backpack panel.
Fold‚ÄëOut Screen Slate ‚Äì transparent tablet showing KPI dashboards.
Use at most 2 gadgets per frame to avoid clutter.
F. Image Guidelines
ElementUpdated RuleStyle ShuffleCombine one city backdrop (solar‚Äë/cyber‚Äë) + one rendering style + optional overlay. Avoid repeating the exact combo twice in a row.Approved Styles‚Ä¢ Cell‚ÄëShaded Action Panel ‚Äì dynamic poses, thick outlines.‚Ä¢ Solarpunk Matte‚ÄëPainting ‚Äì bright, lush scenery.‚Ä¢ Cyberpunk Photobash ‚Äì neon reflections, holograms.‚Ä¢ Voxel / Low‚ÄëPoly Render ‚Äì metaverse sequences.‚Ä¢ CRT Glitch‚ÄëPixel ‚Äì throwback stats & quotes.‚Ä¢ Sticker / Die‚ÄëCut Overlay ‚Äì meme / CTA labels.ToneOptimistic wonder > gritty noir; celebrate experimentation & play.Prompt Skeletoncartoon explorer {activity} in futuristic {city_type}, holo cyan & neon magenta glow, cell‚Äëshaded, slight chromatic aberration, film grainG. Motion & Video Guidelines
Transitions ‚Äì Portal Warp (circular iris with color‚Äëshift), Grid‚ÄëScan Wipe, Drone‚Äë POV swoop.
B‚ÄëRoll ‚Äì 3‚Äì7¬†s city‚Äëflythrough loops, AR interface overlays, solar‚Äëpanel time‚Äëlapses.
Lower Thirds ‚Äì Solar Gold bar @¬†90¬†% opacity; IBM Plex Mono CAPS.
Captions ‚Äì Holo Cyan text, 2¬†px Midnight Grid stroke.
Safe Zones ‚Äì Keep UI <¬†90¬†% width; allow for TikTok/IG blocked regions.
H. Social & Content Templates
FormatTwistCarouselCover slide = Atlas leaping between rooftops; final slide Bit projects CTA QR‚Äëcode.Quote CardSolarpunk skyline silhouette; bot emoji face + quote in Monospace.ThumbnailSplit layout: cityscape left, giant codec‚Äëholo prompt right.Reel/StoryVertical city flythrough intro (0.8¬†s) ‚Üí host talking‚Äëhead overlay.Thread HeadersPixel bitmap title + small drone cameo per tweet.I. Meme & Fun Bits
Formats ‚Äì Voxel dioramas ‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúUI overload‚Äù screenshots ‚Ä¢ Drake meme with bot faceplates.
Humour ‚Äì Self‚Äëaware nerd jokes; never punch down or fetishise dystopia.
Legibility ‚Äì Text ‚â•¬†48¬†px; Holo Cyan or Solar Gold on Midnight Grid.
J. Never‚ÄëUse List (updated)
Fonts: Cursive scripts, generic serifs, Comic Sans, √ºber‚Äësleek corporate sans.
Colours: Beige gradients, pastel lavender, washed‚Äëout corporates.
Motifs: Tired ‚Äúcircuit‚Äëbrain globe,‚Äù foggy handshake robots, floating GPT logo.
Effects: Glass‚Äëmorphism, cheesy lens flare, dripping neon blood.
Copy Buzzwords: ‚ÄúRevolutionary,‚Äù ‚Äúcutting‚Äëedge,‚Äù ‚Äúsecret sauce,‚Äù ‚Äúsynergy,‚Äù ‚Äúmetaverse land grab.‚Äù
K. Accessibility
High contrast (Midnight Grid + light text) as baseline.
Avoid flashing >¬†3¬†Hz; offer alt‚Äëtext & subtitles.
Ready for review. All sections align with the digital adventure direction and new Brand¬†Kit¬†V2. Feel free to mark up anything you‚Äôd like tweaked or expanded!"}
json.brandkit:
{"id":mybk1,"job_role":"brand_architect","content_type":"Brand Kit","title":"My Brand Kit","prompt":"1. Desired Outcome
Free coaches to coach. AI restructures their raw ideas (calls, notes, voice memos) into platform‚Äëready content so they stay in their zone of genius.
Systemise without staff. Deliver self‚Äëhosted automations that let solo owners or small agencies manage multiple brands and workloads without expanding head‚Äëcount.
Productise for agencies. Provide turnkey frameworks agencies can resell or plug into client retainers for instant margin boosts.
Widen the funnel. Publish beginner‚Äëfriendly prompts that give any AI‚Äëcurious person an ‚Äúaha!‚Äù moment before deeper automation tutorials.
2. Audience Snapshot
AI‚Äëcurious coaches, creators & boutique agencies who want practical ways to use AI today‚Äîin work and life‚Äîregardless of skill level.
3. References & Influences
NameCore TraitImplementation CueSteven PressfieldPro‚Äëvs‚Äëamateur mindsetShip the thing; fight ResistanceAndre ChaperonNarrative world‚ÄëbuildingEpisodic open‚Äëloop ‚Äúadventure logs‚ÄùDavid ShapiroTransparent deep‚Äëdive researchPlain‚ÄëEnglish breakdowns of new papersMalcolm GladwellStory‚Äëlinking of unlikely ideasHooks tying odd anecdotes to AI insightsRory SutherlandBehavioural‚Äëecon contrarian riffsPlayful ‚Äúwhat if slower?‚Äù takes on workflowsSeth GodinTribe‚Äëbuilding language‚ÄúPeople like us use AI this way‚Äù promptsSeth RogenIrreverent absurdityOver‚Äëthe‚Äëtop skits featuring sidekick bot4. Known For
Making AI instantly useful through drop‚Äëin prompts & DIY automations that anyone can run today.
5. Action Buckets (No fixed cadence)
Prompt Mini‚ÄëClips ‚Äì 60‚Äësec demos & remixes
AI Digest ‚Äì headline + ‚Äúwhy it matters‚Äù + use‚Äëcase + interesting research/cool breakthroughs
Build‚Äëin‚ÄëPublic Streams ‚Äì live automation builds & stats
AI Content Hour Workshops ‚Äì live co‚Äëbuild sessions delivering a 7‚Äëday schedule
Faceless Account Experiments ‚Äì public dashboards tracking bot‚Äërun test brands
6. Learning Focus
Prompt Engineering & Conversational AI ‚Äì talk so the model thinks for you.
Automation for Lifestyle Leverage ‚Äì n8n & low‚Äëcode flows that reclaim hours.
Post‚ÄëLabour Economics & Lifestyle Design ‚Äì designing a life where tech does the busy‚Äëwork.
Frontier Experiments ‚Äì try weird AI stuff first, share the wins & fails.
7. Unique Positioning Statement
After 10 years and 10 million words written for clients‚Äîdriving $10M+ in revenue‚ÄîI bridge seasoned marketing insight with a nerd‚Äôs love of engineering. I build self‚Äëhosted AI systems that transform raw conversations into optimised, multi‚Äëplatform content, letting owners scale without hiring.
8. Brand Story (3‚ÄëPart)
Catalyst ‚Äì A decade inside agencies watching teams miss the founder‚Äôs real voice.
Core Truth ‚Äì The right prompts + lean automations turn anyone into a high‚Äëoutput content studio.
Proof ‚Äì Live demos, public dashboards, and user wins prove it daily.
9. Voice & Style Guide (unchanged)
Pragmatic ‚Ä¢ Tech‚Äësavvy ‚Ä¢ Empowering ‚Ä¢ Playful ‚Ä¢ Challenger

Active voice, short sentences, ruthless edits.
"But / therefore" transitions to maintain logic.
Open loops, cliff‚Äëhangers; skip fluffy intros.
Forbidden: overblown hype, empty fillers, corporate‚Äëspeak, social‚Äëguru fluff.
10. Content Pillars (flexible %)
PillarRough ShareExample FormatsCore MetricAI‚ÄëPowered Content Automation70 %Mini‚Äëclips, build streams"I used this prompt" repliesAI Fundamentals & Prompt Literacy20 %AI Digest, research explainersNew follower ‚Äúaha!‚Äù DMsLifestyle Design & Experiments10 %Hobby vlogs, sandbox reportsEngagement on off‚Äëscreen posts11. Positive & Negative Associations (unchanged)
Positive: Relief ‚Ä¢ Creative freedom ‚Ä¢ Empowerment ‚Ä¢ Transparency ‚Ä¢ Fun & curiosity ‚Ä¢ Feeling smarter
Negative: Complexity ‚Ä¢ Overwhelm ‚Ä¢ Hype noise ‚Ä¢ Superficial salesiness ‚Ä¢ Inauthentic bot deceit ‚Ä¢ Bureaucratic boredom
12. Audience Skepticism ‚Üí Responses (expanded)
‚ÄúAI content is generic.‚Äù ‚Üí We feed the model your transcripts‚Äîno boiler‚Äëplate.
‚ÄúI can‚Äôt code.‚Äù ‚Üí Drag‚Äëand‚Äëdrop dashboards + one API key.
‚ÄúI‚Äôll lose my voice.‚Äù ‚Üí Prompts preserve tone first, polish second.
‚ÄúData privacy?‚Äù ‚Üí Self‚Äëhosted pipelines = keep IP on your server.
13. Character System ‚ú® (revamped)
RoleVisual SnapshotPersonalityUsageHero ‚Äì "Atlas"Young cartoon adventurer (Indiana‚ÄëJones vibe) in classic explorer gear plus wearable tech ‚Äì AR monocle, grappling‚Äëhook USB‚ÄëC whipCurious, optimistic, resourcefulAppears in thumbnails, comics, motion stingersSidekick ‚Äì "Bit" (AI Drone)Floating holographic robo‚Äëorb with emotive LED eyes; projects mini‚ÄëscreensAnalytical, witty, slightly nerdyExplains concepts & delivers ‚Äúpro‚Äëtips‚Äù(Villain retired for now ‚Äì content focuses on exploration & discovery.)

14. Interactions & Scenes
Prompt Quest ‚Äì Atlas asks Bit a question; Bit flashes prompt formula; treasure map UI overlay.
Automation Cliff ‚Äì Atlas deploys a no‚Äëcode flow; Bit projects success metrics fireworks.
Sandbox Expedition ‚Äì Atlas & Bit run experiments; panels show win/fail counters."}
json.content: And that‚Äôs kind of the fun thing about doing this building public content stuff is, I don‚Äôt really have agenda for this, and it‚Äôs gonna automatically get turned into clips for me. So I don‚Äôt have to like. fret and worry about that, and agonize over like what‚Äôs good and what‚Äôs not. I‚Äôm like fucking. Let‚Äôs try it out. See what happens. Shout out to Jeff Miller for always talking about. Just test it. Just put it out there. See what happens. the market will decide like what‚Äôs good and not but what I want to build is a lifestyle business, where I can focus more of my time on building these cool things and setting them up for business to use rather than being kind of in the trenches, having to like. Write all the copy and things myself. And I definitely don‚Äôt want to build something that‚Äôs big, and, you know, is trying to do a hundred grand a month, or 500 grand a month, or a million a month with a bunch of employees. I have to spend my time managing things like that.

current_prompt_content_type.title: Write Post
current_prompt_content_type.prompt:
You will transform a raw idea or piece of content into a short, punchy, high-impact Twitter
 post. The post must blend Alex Hormozi-style clarity and first-principles framing with the
 ‚ÄúAI for Coaches‚Äù brand voice‚Äîapproachable, practical, and empowering (‚Äúindie hacker meets
 curious guide‚Äù).
 
 ‚Ä¢ Established coaches earning $50k +/mo
 ‚Ä¢ Already creating content and seeking to scale their unique genius‚Äînot replace it
 
 The core objective is to build authority by delivering maximum value-per-word, leaving the
 reader smarter and armed with actionable insight.
 

 
 You are an elite AI assistant and expert copywriter. You specialize in distilling complex
 ideas into concise, high-impact social posts that challenge assumptions, reveal hard truths,
 and equip readers with clear action steps‚Äîall while maintaining brand voice integrity.
 

 
 1. Analyze the source:
 a. Deeply examine [SOURCE_CONTENT] and surface the single most powerful idea,
 insight, or hard truth.
 
 2. Adopt the voice:
 a. Embody the tone rules and language guidelines defined in [BRAND_KIT].
 b. Use active voice, direct phrasing, and curiosity-building hooks.
 c. Ruthlessly trim fluff; define complex terms in plain language when needed.
 
 3. Frame correctly:
 a. Combine a Hard-Truth challenge (‚ÄúYou think X, reality is Y‚Äù) with a Helpful-Guide
 insight (‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the framework that worked‚Äù).
 
 4. Position AI as a lever:
 a. Emphasize AI as a system for scaling the coach‚Äôs own ideas and expertise‚Äînot a
 voice replacement.
 
 5. Format for readability:
 a. Keep the post ‚â§ 200 words in a single text block.
 b. Use 1‚Äì2 sentence paragraphs with double line breaks for white space.
 c. Employ bullet points (‚Ä¢) or numbered lists when helpful.
 d. Use emojis sparingly as emphasis, never decoration.
 
 6. Optional CTA:
 a. If included, end with a line formatted exactly as
 ‚Äú[OPTIONAL_CTA]: Your CTA text here.‚Äù
 
 7. Strictly avoid:
 a. Contrived guru stories leading to pitches.
 b. Clich√© lead-ins (‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the hard truth,‚Äù ‚ÄúThe secret is‚Ä¶‚Äù).
 c. Generic, bland statements; corporate jargon; guru-speak.
 
 

 
 The direct user of this prompt is a state-of-the-art Large Language Model (e.g., ChatGPT-4o) capable of sophisticated text transformation and brand-voice alignment.

json.Clip Description: Why obsess over perfect content when AI lets you test, iterate, and let the market decide? Discover how building in public and embracing experimentation can unlock a lifestyle business‚Äîso you spend more time creating, less time managing.

json.Analysis:
The opening line‚Äî'That's kind of the fun thing about doing this building in public content stuff...'‚Äîimmediately frames the clip as a personal insight into a modern, experimental approach. It taps into curiosity and the 'behind-the-scenes' appeal, which is compelling for creators and coaches.
